Talents
Hello
My name is Omphalus Harkie Kua, AKA Ompa. I am a graphic designer who also enjoys coding for websites. The creation of this online portfolio is a testament of my eagerness to become good at the frontend of web development. This is a product of my coding and design skills with general consideration for UI/UX. This portfolio is a working progress that will always reflect the growth of my passion in the creative industry.

Enjoy!
Recent Project- Web
       
Pecxer Financial Serices
This website has been built using Wordpress (CMS). WordPress allowed me design on the fly with the Elementor my page builder. I am currently applying the Google Analytics & Google Webmaster tools to optimize the search results for this website. This is my first real WordPress project which I attempted alone.
Recent Project - Web
       
Wedding Album
The lovely couple seen here are my old friends from College. I was happy to be invited to their wonderful wedding as a guest. It turned out to be a good wedding gift.
Recent Project - Grafix
       
T-shirt Prints
Done in Illustrator and Photoshop, I manipulated the logo the make a T-shirt design for a NGO organisation here in Wellington New Zealand.
Adobe Suite
The Creative Workshop
I remember how excited I was when I first downloaded Photoshop in 2011. I practically stayed up all night to figure it out. Later that week I enrolled at the Wellington Institute of Technology and four years later I graduated with a Bachelor of Creative Technology with a major in Digital Media.
Today I still use the Adobe products in my work. I am still learning to be great at all Adobe products. Below are some of the softwares I am familiar with along with few examples of work.

Photoshop



I created this work with Photoshop. I called it the Bi-maid. Photoshop gets 5-Stars from me.

Digital Painting (Bimaid)

Illustrator



Illustrator is my go-to software for design based work with typography. It is great for pieces with high-end vector graphics. Illustrator is simply great and I love working with it.

Banner for PNG independence day promo

Indesign



Indesign is another great tool I use for consistent page layout structure. I find it to be very amusing as a software that brings images and texts together in a layout and file arrangements.

Print project- Calendar 2014

After Effects



This is a very powerful tool which I wish to master.

Kumi's Logo animation

Premier Pro



Who doesn't love Premier Pro. Definitely love how simple it is and still it can produce great end products. Totally Awesome

Summary

It is amazing to see a project transmitted through different mediums to come together at the end as a finished project such as film, animation or music video. The planning that is required is certainly important. Although sometimes I find myself diving straight into the software and throw things around until I see a way. The Adobe Creatives Suite has catered for much of my creative mind in the digital world. My only wish is to one day own a studio where I can realease all my creative flare.
Web
Where am I with that?

I am driving momentum towards web design and web development as a Frontend web developer. This is because I already have a sound Graphic Design skill and I enjoy creating great graphics. Learning to code has ignited my technical mind and has since kept me interested and keen to learn to code.

Read more

I took a full year course at Yoobee School of Design in 2016 to learn Web development. There, my graphic design skills helped me build or at least design great frontend User Interface with wire-frames and mockups.
making a simple Html page come alive was really satisfying. I was never the best student in class but I was certainly keen to learn to find my style in the web development field. I am still learning a whole bunch and I wish to expand further to become a great programmer for Apps one day. This portfolio is a result of my persistence in self-learning.

WEB SKILLS

I like exploring new and creative layouts when building wire-frames and planning a color scheme for a theme. I have a local development setup which I am familair with. I am also very familiar with the WordPress (CMS). I always like to research and find the effective User experience with a good built in User interface.

Graphix
Where am I with that?

I am fairly confident with graphic design in the scheme of Creativity. I have found a real motive and passion for it. I am still learning to perfect my style.

Read more

I like to think that any design is a 'navigational path'. Therefore a good design allows for a great connection or experience. It certainly serves as a means of relaying a message or forces an action, feeling or thought upon the audience. Graphic design creates a visual emotion. Basically, if you can see it, you are connected.
Design elements such as typography, Shapes, Colors, Texts, Images, Size, and composition can alter one's emotion. Yes composition is everything.

Typography

Using different typefaces helps with my design to focus the theme to a certain genre, whether it be retro, contemporary or a particular theme of the design. I use it to improve the final outlook of a design. My favorite Sans serif fonts are Helvetica and Open Sans and Roboto.

Little Achievements

I won first prize in a national art competition in my country for my year group when I was 13 years old.
I was picked to play Fullback for my country's National Rugby League Team against the Australian Kangaroos in 2007 at 24years old. That was totally epic!

Read more

I was nominated for a sportsperson of the year award by the Nelson Tasman District when I was doing my final year at Nelson College in 2001.
Apart from that, I enjoy playing guitar, write songs, and do painting as a hobby. I am very interested in Golf.

Secret Affair

I certainly love my hobbies. I play guitar, do paintings - water, oil or acrylic based. I also love to write songs and make music beats and I love playing Rugby League.

About
About this- App
Summary

This web app has allowed me to appreciate the development aspect of the project itself. I have used gulp to precompile and minify the sass, script.js, and images files and HTML. I have also run autoprefixer to handle the Flex-box items. I have tried to make the site Responsive across mobile, tablet and desktop . Most of the device testing has been done on my phone and using Chrome's inspector tool for device testing. There are minor bugs on a mobile device in Landscape view mainly with the drop-down menu not showing when alternating between different views from Portrait to landscape.
As for browser compatibility, I have not done any resolution testing on any other browser apart from Chrome. As mentioned earlier, the site is a working progress. Therefore I will work on each bug from time to time to get the app working fluidly.
Obout- Ompa
Omphalus Harkie Kua

Ompa is a young minded Graphics and Web enthusiast. He also enjoys editing for film and music videos. He thinks of himself as a multimedia artist.
Ompa comes from the beautiful Chimbu Province situated in the heart of Papua New Guinea. He arrived in New Zealand in 1999 on an academic scholarship. He has played representative and international Rugby League whilst living in N.Z. He has been a single father to his only son (Nelann) since 2008, after a possible proffessional League career deemed unlikely.
He then went back to studying. In 2014 he graduated with a Bachelor of Creative Technology with a major in Digital Media. In 2016 he enrolled at Yoobee School of Design to learn coding.

He is currently hoping to get real experience in the creative industry where design and coding can become one.
Today, Omphalus is still a single-dad and he hopes to secure a future for Nelann and himself.
